data.text: Something that suggests the presence or existence of a fact, condition, or quality.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: A high temperature is a sign of fever.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An act or gesture used to convey an idea, a desire, information, or a command: synonym: gesture.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A displayed structure bearing lettering or symbols, used to identify or advertise a place of business.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a motel with a flashing neon sign outside.

data.text: A posted notice bearing a designation, direction, or command.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: an EXIT sign above a door; a traffic sign.

data.text: A conventional figure or device that stands for a word, phrase, or operation; a symbol, as in mathematics or in musical notation.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An indicator, such as a dropping or footprint, of the trail of an animal.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
